title: 7 Simple Steps to Create ASCII Art

steps.title: Find a text editor to use to make your ASCII art (example:
steps.content: Find a text editor to use to make your ASCII art (example: Notepad).

steps.title: Set the font to one with fixed width.
steps.content: Set the font to one with fixed width. In Notepad, the only font that you can use is fixed width. This means that you can use spaces; in fonts without fixed width, spaces will be smaller, which can mess up text formatting.

steps.title: Think of an object to draw.
steps.content: Think of an object to draw. Start with something easy, such as a flower.

steps.title: Use characters that take up more space for darker parts of the picture.
steps.content: Use characters that take up more space for darker parts of the picture.

steps.title: Use characters that take up less space for lighter parts of the picture.
steps.content: Use characters that take up less space for lighter parts of the picture.

steps.title: Use various slants and slashes to make lines.
steps.content: Use various slants and slashes to make lines. You will be forced to only use large angles. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Save it and show your friends and family, or publish it on a website.
steps.content: Save it and show your friends and family, or publish it on a website.
